title: Kristi Noem: Trump should 'get rid' of FEMA
shortDescription: Homeland Security Secreatry Kristi Noem's remarks come as the administration seeks to pare down the size of the federal government.

shortDescription: Three federal courts have blocked President Trump's order denying citizenship to children born to parents without authorization to be in the U.S.

title: 'Gulf of America Day': Trump makes proclamation on Super Bowl flight
shortDescription: As he was flying over the Gulf of Mexico, Donald Trump said he was proclaiming Feb. 9, as 'Gulf of America Day' as he 'restores American pride.'

title: Judges are pausing Trump policy changes. But for how long?
shortDescription: Plus: President Donald Trump says Elon Musk's next DOGE targets are the Pentagon and Education Department. This and more stories on The Excerpt.

title: Trump will slap 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports
shortDescription: In 2024, 23% of all steel used in the U.S. was imported, with Canada, Brazil, Mexico, South Korea and Vietnam as the biggest suppliers.

title: Trump blasts court decisions stalling executive orders
shortDescription: Trump administration officials have criticized federal court rulings over policies that could lead to showdown over executive power.

title: Trump signs order on school choice and funding
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has signed two executive orders on school funding that fulfill promises he made on the campaign trail.

title: Trump losing patience with ceasefire deal over hostages' condition
shortDescription: "They look like Holocaust survivors," Trump said Sunday of three recently-freed Israeli hostages. "They were in horrible condition."

title: Trump plans to stop producing new pennies
shortDescription: President Donald Trump announced he is directing the treasury secretary to stop the production of pennies as a cost-cutting measure.

title: Who is sitting with Trump at Super Bowl? Politicians, family and more
shortDescription: Members of government and member's of Donald Trump's family are sitting with the president as he becomes first president to attend a Super Bowl.

title: Steel tariffs coming; Trump looks at Education, Defense for savings
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said he would target Education and Defense for cost-cutting next and would impose tariffs on steel and aluminum Monday.

title: Majority of US adults approve of Trump's presidency, new poll finds
shortDescription: A majority of US adults polled by CBS News/YouGov approved of how President Donald Trump was handling the presidency in his first month.

title: Trump picks Super Bowl winner, pledges Musk probe of military and Education

title: Dems open to shutting down government to oppose Trump 'if we have to'
shortDescription: Congressional Democrats are furious over the new administration's unilateral moves to dismantle government programs and agencies

title: Trump says he spoke with Putin about ending the war in Ukraine
shortDescription: Trump has promised to end the war in Ukraine but not yet set out in public how he would do so.

title: White South Africans rejecting Trump's immigration offer
shortDescription: Trump signed an executive order to cut U.S. aid to South Africa, which provided for U.S. resettlement of some "victims of racial discrimination."

title: Trump administration orders employees to stop work at watchdog CFPB
shortDescription: The CFPB is an independent government agency tasked with protecting consumers and enforcing rules for banks, credit unions and other lenders.

title: Millenials made it to the White House first with JD Vance. Gen X?
shortDescription: VP JD Vance, 40, made history on as the first of his generation in the role. His moment highlights another generation's notable absence.

title: White House declines funding for CFPB, suggesting agency nears end
shortDescription: A White House official said Saturday he would decline more funding for the Consumer Finance Protection Bureau, signaling a possible end to the agency.

title: Trump revokes security clearances for legal rivals: New York Post
shortDescription: President Donald Trump told the New York Post he ordered the revocation of security clearances to officials he's sparred with in court.

title: 'The bridge is burned': Federal workers on Trump's buyout
shortDescription: Frustration, lengthy commutes, lack of trust: Federal employees explain why they accepted Trump's buyout offer.

title: The Trump administration has been losing in court - will it last?
shortDescription: Judges have pumped the breaks on Trump's efforts to freeze spending, curtail birthright citizenship, reduce the federal workforce and more.
